revised_title: Genetic Analysis of 'Rogues' in Culinary Peas (Pisum sativum)
tldr: The authors study the genetic traits of 'rogue' peas, which exhibit distinct morphological differences from typical peas. They find that these rogues arise sporadically from self-fertilized seeds and have a unique set of genetic properties. The authors also investigate the distribution of these traits in the offspring of crossbred plants and observe the progressive assumption of rogue characters in intermediate plants.
